article.headline: Hereâs how to spot whether a stimulus deal will bring a âshort-livedâ stock market bounce or a sustained rally, strategist says
article.body: The stock market bounce following any new stimulus deal is likely to be 'short-lived', Mill Tabak & Co warned. Matthias Hangst/Getty Images Any near-term bounce from a new fiscal plan is likely to be âshort-lived,â according to Miller Tabak & Coâs lead strategist Matt Maley. Maley said Trumpâs positive COVID-19 test improved the chances of a new stimulus boost, as it gave both sides the opportunity to concede ground without losing face. However, he warned multiple factors meant any pop fueled by a deal would be brief. Read: Trumpâs coronavirus recovery, stimulus hope, election clarity: Whatâs really driving the market? âWe believe an agreement on a new fiscal plan is likely, but weâre not so sure it will help the stock market rally in a sustainable way. The market is still quite overvalued and the combination of the weakening employment picture plus a second wave of the virus does not bode well for any improvement for the âEâ part [earnings] of the P/E ratio going forward,â Maley said. âMore importantly, history shows us that stimulus programs play a much bigger role as a catalyst for a strong/sustained rally when the stock market is flat on its backâ¦not after a strong six-month rally,â he said, noting that the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% was still more than 50% above its March lows,â he said. He added that another âdown-legâ to the September correction will come in October before we see a sustainable rally in stocks. But the strategist said Miller Tabak & Co one important indicator â chip stocks â would signal whether they were wrong. âThe chip stocks have been a very important leadership group for the broad stock market, so itâs action over the coming days and weeks should be vitally important.â He said if the SMH semiconductor ETF SMH, +1.71% can break above its September closing highs of $183.55 it was âvery, very bullish on several different levels.â âIf that happens, weâll have to change our tune rather quickly.â
